title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
01:22 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
07:01 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
07:01 <Denis> has quit  
07:19 <sdumitriu> has quit  
07:38 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:42 <rrodriguez> has quit  
08:26 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:27 <vmassol> has quit  
09:48 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
09:55 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <tmortagne> has quit  
10:25 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
11:20 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
12:21 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
13:00 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:02 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:06 <sburjan`> has quit  
13:06 <sburjan\_> is now known as <sburjan`>  
13:10 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:15 <+sburjan> hello vmassol . It seems I am not allowed to assign tasks on JIRA. At least not on playform and enterprise  
13:15 <+sburjan> \*platform  
13:16 <+sburjan> not even to me (which I wanted to actually do regarding the improvement I proposed yesterday)  
13:31 <vmassol> sburjan: checking  
13:31 <vmassol> that you can't assign to other is normal  
13:37 <vmassol> there's no special right for assigning to self  
13:38 <vmassol> the idea is that only committers can assign issues  
13:39 <vmassol> I can assign you, just give me the issue url  
13:41 <+sburjan> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7070  
13:42 <vmassol> hmm strange, I can't save http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XSLT+Macro  
13:42 <vmassol> (gives a stack trace)  
13:48 <+sburjan> thanks vmassol  
14:08 <pturcotte> has quit  
14:15 <rrodriguez> has quit  
14:40 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
15:00 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
15:55 <vmassol> sdumitriu: would it be hard for you to move the model code currently in sandbox in a xwiki-platform branch?…. You gave me some scripts but I couldn't run them on my mac...  
15:56 <@sdumitriu> OK, I'll do it  
15:56 <vmassol> great thanks :)  
16:04 <vmassol> tmortagne: did you use the Template for creating the new RN?  
16:05 <vmassol> (i don't think you did)  
16:05 <+tmortagne> vmassol: nop I copied 3.2M1 actually, did not know there was a template  
16:05 <vmassol> when you click on Add Page  
16:05 <+sburjan> i see it misses the supported browsers section  
16:05 <vmassol> there's now a template i created  
16:05 <+tmortagne> ok  
16:06 <vmassol> I don't know if it's useful yet  
16:06 <vmassol> but there's only one way to know… :)  
16:06 <vmassol> (to try using it)  
16:06 <+tmortagne> sure  
16:06 <+sburjan> yepp. I was thinking about this for the MTR's also, but I don;t think it's okay to crowd the Add Page options  
16:06 <vmassol> it's not crowded sburjan  
16:06 <vmassol> it's only activated for a given space  
16:07 <vmassol> but IMO the best for RN might be to create a small App similar to Extensions  
16:07 <vmassol> (it's probably better than a static Template)  
16:08 <vmassol> (Templates are so Wiki 1.0 IMO ;))  
16:08 <+sburjan> :d  
16:11 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'll recreate the page  
16:11 <vmassol> ah you're doing it?  
16:11 <vmassol> hey it's not me  
16:11 <vmassol> I iahven't deleted it  
16:11 <+tmortagne> yes that's what i'm doing  
16:11 <vmassol> ok  
16:11 <+sburjan> the bug is back ! :)  
16:11 <+tmortagne> i did nt deleted it  
16:11 <vmassol> thought I had fixed it  
16:11 <+tmortagne> I renamed it  
16:11 <vmassol> tmortagne: that's normal  
16:11 <vmassol> creation/deletion  
16:11 <vmassol> but the author isn't  
16:12 <+tmortagne> i know  
16:12 <vmassol> sburjan: I think it's a different bug  
16:12 <vmassol> the author isn't set in rename  
16:12 <vmassol> current author  
16:13 <vmassol> checking code  
16:49 <+tmortagne> vmassol: did you changed the parent in Extension.Wiki Manager Plugin  or it it a bug ?  
16:49 <vmassol> parent?  
16:49 <vmassol> I removed the title which was set  
16:49 <+tmortagne> look  at http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Wiki+Manager+Plugin?viewer=changes&rev2=11.4  
16:50 <vmassol> I haven't changed it  
16:50 <vmassol> so it looks like a bug  
16:50 <+tmortagne> I think the parent is not properly serialized, we used to have this bug but it was fixed  
16:50 <+tmortagne> look like it came back  
16:50 <vmassol> since it's in the same wiki  
16:50 <+tmortagne> yes  
16:52 <+tmortagne> vmassol: are you trying to fix it from the UI ?  
16:52 <+tmortagne> it's impossible  
16:52 <vmassol> nope  
16:53 <vmassol> I'm just fixing the download link  
16:54 <+tmortagne> hmm checking something  
16:55 <+tmortagne> XWikiDocument#getParent look ok so it's maybe a UI bug since you can't provide a direct string anymore  
16:57 <+tmortagne> or it's a history UI bug  
16:57 <+tmortagne> since it looks like it indicate the parent changed in several versions  
16:58 <+tmortagne> in each version it seems  
17:00 <+tmortagne> looks like it's a history view bug actually  
17:01 <+tmortagne> I changed it to from "Main.WebHome" to "extensions:Main.WebHome" and i can see has been changed when I re-edit the page but the history does not tell anything  
17:01 <+tmortagne> looks like the history always takes the local reference as "Previous value"  
17:02 <+tmortagne> but it take the proper "New value"  
17:23 <vmassol> has quit  
17:31 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
17:35 <sburjan> has quit  
17:35 <Denis> has quit  
17:43 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
18:34 <Spazholio> has joined #xwiki  
18:35 <Spazholio> Is it possible to edit the tagcloud macro easily?  Or pass it a parameter to limit either the amount of tags returned or only shows a tag if there are X number of instances of the tag?
